title: How to Make Confetti Candles

parts.name: Adding the confetti to the candle jar

steps.headline: Obtain a suitable jar.
steps.description: Clean the jar well with dish washing soap, then wipe it dry with a clean towel.

steps.headline: Pour some Mod Podge into a small container.
steps.description: Dip a brush into the Mod Podge adhesive.

steps.headline: Wipe the brush on the sides of the jar.
steps.description: Spread the Mod Podge from top to bottom.

steps.headline: Pour the confetti into the jar.
steps.description: As you add the confetti, slowly roll the jar so that the confetti sticks to the wall of the jar all the way around.

steps.headline: Prepare the candle wax.
steps.description: Slice the wax into small pieces.

steps.headline: Put the wax pieces on a double burner.
steps.description: Heat and let it simmer until the wax melts.

steps.headline: Attach the candle wick to a stick.
steps.description: Place the stick on the center of the jar's opening.

steps.headline: Place a funnel in the jar to avoid spilling as you pour the wax.
Pour the melted wax into the jar.
Let the candle wax cool down until it hardens.
When the wax turns to white, the candle is almost ready to use.
steps.description: Leave the wick holder in place until the candle has hardened, then snip it away from the stick, leaving just the candle wick in place.

steps.headline: Once hardened, light up the candle.

text: Adding the confetti to the candle jar Obtain a suitable jar. Clean the jar well with dish washing soap, then wipe it dry with a clean towel. Pour some Mod Podge into a small container. Dip a brush into the Mod Podge adhesive. Wipe the brush on the sides of the jar. Spread the Mod Podge from top to bottom. Pour the confetti into the jar. As you add the confetti, slowly roll the jar so that the confetti sticks to the wall of the jar all the way around. Making the candle Prepare the candle wax. Slice the wax into small pieces. Put the wax pieces on a double burner. Heat and let it simmer until the wax melts. Attach the candle wick to a stick. Place the stick on the center of the jar's opening. Place a funnel in the jar to avoid spilling as you pour the wax.  Pour the melted wax into the jar.  Let the candle wax cool down until it hardens.  When the wax turns to white, the candle is almost ready to use. Leave the wick holder in place until the candle has hardened, then snip it away from the stick, leaving just the candle wick in place. Once hardened, light up the candle. Enjoy your work!
